comments.commentBody: STATISM before ETATISM until the very end.  I did finish, but I did this one from the bottom up.  Wouldn't ÉTATISMe be the French equivalent?
You'd think...

Whenever I read a piece about antioxidants I wonder if the proponents have any idea what they are talking about. I am an organic chemist, and yes I understand that compounds that are highly colored often have multiple double bonds that are highly reactive with radicals, but under what conditions? Oh sure the colored compounds react with radicals when you deliberately mix them together, but what I mean is how do these radical scavenger molecules manage to get into the body and travel to the cellular location where they might usefully interact. Everything that you eat goes first to the liver via the portal vein, before it can go anywhere else. Do you know how the liver functions - lots of oxidation reactions. I seriously question whether any of these wonderful "antioxidants" ever gets past the liver. Just because something is an antioxidant  in vitro, or has anti cancer properties, or antibiotic or antiviral properties in vitro, does not mean it is useful in vivo, because it has to be able to get to the proper site in the body before it can do anything useful....and most of them don't.

I would add, too, that many of the same people who praise naturally occurring antioxidants think that food preservatives are akin to poison... and yet many preservatives are antioxidants, added to food to keep the oils and fats in them from turning rancid through oxidation.

I'm an organic chemist also and there's plenty of research out there on the subject.  Recent findings show that dietary free radical inhibitors aren't all they've been cracked up to be but the beneficial effects of the antioxidants cited must be due to something

Perhaps these publicity stunts are mechanisms by which appropriate white anger--anger towards, say, bankers and CEOs--is obscured and somehow redirected to causes that favor, say, bankers and CEOs. Perhaps there is a conspiracy of, say, bankers and CEOs, to produce such results. To see these stunts for what they are requires a willings to ally oneself to brown and black people, a requirement that relatively few rural and Southern whites are willing to take on.

This article has veered so far from the truth. It seems that all publications want to convince themselves and the American people that this jobs report was very good. The truth is there's no wage pressure. Job participation is at it's lowest level in thirty years, and out of the almost 500.000 jobs that were added in the past two months, only 19,000 jobs went to people between the ages of 19-54. This tells us that the jobs were part time, and low wages.
Why do the newspapers and our politicians want to insist that the jobs market is so rosy? Among other things they want to justify the Feds raising rates so the too big to fail banks can make more money and by the way there was no increase in people's savings after the Fed hiked interest rates last month.
The stock market is not buying this. I even heard a number of people on CNBC of all places stating that rates should not have been raised.

"Why does everyone need to own a home?".....Consider that one way or another you will buy the house you live in. You can rent the house and thus buy the house you live in for someone else, or you can own the house and buy it for yourself.

If automation that obsolesces human labor proceeds apace, I suspect that all societies, including ours, will be talking about UBI, at least as an interim mechanism to keep consumer spending up and human misery down. But if we get to the point at which so MUCH human labor is made obsolete that what remains simply cannot generate the economic activity necessary to support everyone else, then we're going to have to invent new economic frameworks we've never seen before to support our vast populations. If we fail, we'll see catastrophic social disruptions.

As to women, I think the focus is too narrow for “payback”. One means of transferring wealth from remaining producers to everyone else is to start recognizing activity as compensable production that was never properly compensated as production when by rights it should have been – and child-rearing and caregiving generally would be among my first choices. We’d likely need to use the tax system as the means for effecting the transfer, but we could invent something more or less direct, as well.
This soup turned out great! For her serving, my wife also added parmesan cheese. Yummy.

The hysteria is warranted: there were coordinated sexual assaults and rapes on hundreds of women in Cologne, Hamburg and a few other German towns, Salzburg, and towns in Finland. The media covered it all up, a shocking dereliction of duty to report the news. Why are we having a discussion about the feelings of the men who committed these crimes and whether they will be offended that we are stating the obvious, that thousands of them across Europe were of the same ethnic group?
A war on women was brazenly unleashed that night around Europe. If the perps were local nationals, then throw the book at them and put them away for a long time. If the attackers were refugees and asylum seekers, then they should forfeit the right to live in the West.

Those men - local or refugees - knew wrong from right but decided to prey on physically weaker victims. These were crimes of control and delight in the infliction of terror. Subjecting them to culture classes will do no more than lecturing to murderers that taking a life is wrong.

It sure would be nice if the politically correct would stop throwing women as a group under the bus in the name of trying to judge these mass atrocities as some kind of balancing test. Punish the offenders and keep anyone with the mindset that women are fair game to be raped out of the West, period.

Actually, we should not assume that the Islamic males knew wrong from right in our Western social context.  One could very easily argue that their social context molded by their religious book, shaped them into thinking that what they were doing was part of the global war (jihad as they call it) against non-muslims; and because of this morally justified.

Hysteria is never warranted.
And it is still not clear if these attacks were in fact "coordinated." If so, how?
If you were here in Germany, you would know that the media is definitely not covering anything up; they do seem to be doing a good job of covering up arson attacks on refugee shelters.
Hysteria implies an over reaction. To be  alarmed about sexual assault of 100s girls is an appropriate reaction. Why isn't this writer more concerned?

The predator has the element of surprise.
It is very hard to stop someone intent on shooting you.
Are you going to prance around with your gun drawn.
I see a bulge in his pants.
He looks shifty eyed.
Might be a gun.
Have to shoot first because I can't take a chance.
Do we want to live in a society like that or would we rather ban guns in PUBLIC.
Heller / McDonald upheld the right of gun ownership in the home but allowed for restrictions in public.
Governor Ronald Reagan signed the California Mulford Act which mandated 5 years in the clink for anyone possessing a loaded gun in public.
We should increase the time and make that law uniform in all states.

One major difference between Der Ring des Nibelungen and the Star Wars series: Wagner was the creative force behind his entire Ring, while George Lucas had bailed by the time the Force Awakens was made.

And there are jarring differences between A New Hope, the Empire Strikes Back Return of the Jedi, and the latest episode.

In the earlier episodes, Princess Leia was for a short period the sexual plaything of Jabba the Hut. That is too politically incorrect for modern sensibilities.

Moreover, in the earlier episode, Princess Leia was someone to be protected. in the Force Awakens, Rey becomes as violent as the men.

And if there is one criticism to level, one overarching defect in the latest Star Wars movie, it is that the violence has been increased to absurd levels. Whole planets are vaporized. And the good guys do just as much killing as the bad.

Liberals sometimes wonder where Joe six-pack gets his penchant for guns. It's the Star Wars franchise.

Somehow we have denatured the sex but increased the violence. Liberals regard that as progress. And they could not be more wrong.

Uh, the Death Star destroyed an entire planet of billions in the original! And young Luke cheers as he kills Empire ships. Also, Leia was always a leader, tough, good with guns, cynical, and in no way weak.

I appreciate a cool response to the Oregon malcontents. Let them sit there until the locals boot them out. But as they are essentially breaking the law, threatening violence, trespassing, and aiming guns at public servants--perhaps their out-of-states homes could receive judgments and their incomes frozen for the length of their trespass. Afterall they are keeping people from doing their jobs and costing the Oregon and federal taxpayer onerous fees in overtime. Didn't the kids who started fires in a tony real estate development receive prison sentences?

I haven't heard of a PALATINATE before, but the explanations from Martin and John explained it well. I had to look that answer up, as no amount of crosses were going to help.

The bottom half came pretty easily, but I was stuck in the north and gave up. Still a fine a Saturday puzzle, and I learned a new word.
I second everything you said.

I find it interesting that she ascribes a lack of enthusiasm about HC in young women to a fault in the young women.

Generally, that's not a way to win people over to your side.

The question she was asked had to do with "a difference between young women and women our age in their excitement about Hillary Clinton?" Her answer described what she thinks is responsible for the difference.  Considering complacency to be a fault is your interpretation.

"Gun zealots romanticize guns. They picture themselves as superheroes"

There are some like that.

Then again, there are some like me.

You wouldn't accept such a generalization about all blacks or most anybody else. It isn't accurate or helpful to do it here either.
Gee, two replies. You buoy my spirits.
Please note that the EPA's budget has been continually under Republican assault; their latest cut $718M.
Try to keep him locked up this time.
Let's get a pool started on how soon he will "escape" again!

When people get ill one of the first things they should get tested is their blood and tissues for chemical exposure. I think we would be shocked if we knew the chemical load our bodies and our children's bodies are carrying. And strangest of all is to believe that we're not somehow affected.

Life gets more and more like a comic book every day, but without the humor and fun.

This is real life, and rootin' tootin' ain't the solution. Doing a job well requires practice and (h/t Mark Thomasen) a sense of one's limitations. The beginning of wisdom, as the good book says ...

I know perfectly well that a gun in my hand will be used against me, because I don't want to maim and kill, and I would hesitate. What scares me is that these stockpiles of weapons growing in what was once a country I could respect and be proud of are making people more and more like animals (though that is to insult animals, who mostly don't kill unnecessarily). It seems to be all about fear, anger, and hatred of people who are different.

The ascendance of fantasy over reality is producing a perfect storm of danger. I am much more afraid of those who are able to call Obama a liar and pretend he is coming to take their guns, and running to buy ever more guns, without a sense that they ought to learn how to use them and keep them safe, than I am of outsiders. I cannot avoid the feeling that like Ammon Bundy they feel entitled to things that don't belong to them, like my life and liberty, never mind the happiness part.

Peace is a value deeply to be desired. War, not so much. But if you all want to shoot so much, how about you volunteer for the army and learn what it's all about instead of using us as proxies for your misdirection frustration.

@Susan Anderson,
I know. I've seen the comments and don't know why more people don't heed them.

1-9-16@2:21 am est

"What scares me is that these stockpiles of weapons growing ..." The number of people who actually own guns in the US is decreasing as a percentage of the total population. Only 30% of Americans own guns, down from almost 50% in the late 1970's. Fewer people own guns, but many of the ones who do own guns own LOTS of them. That's the scary bit. A gun in the home to protect the family is fine and rational. But there's a hard core of gun nuts out there who own a whole garage-full of them. That smacks of addiction. Most folks can have a drink or two of an evening and not do anything stupid, but some people drink a whole bottle of gin and are the worse for it. Those are the ones who are scary, mostly because there's no rational discussion one can have with an alcoholic.
J

Why can't Hillary Clinton support the current legislation, the Family Act? Why does Hillary Clinton reject the strength and straightforwardness of an earned benefit program, like LBJ's Medicare or FDR's Social security? Why does Hillary Clinton call anyone making up to $250,000 a year middle class when the median income is below $30,000 a year? Why does Hillary Clinton tell voters drowning from the costs of health care deductibles, dividends, copays, and out-of-network costs that she won't raise their taxes even a dollar to save them thousands with Medicare For All? Why does Hillary Clinton claim that her financial regulation would be more effective? Why does Hillary Clinton pretend misrepresent Bernie Sanders as ever being against more gun control? Why were Hillary Clinton's patent tweak and toothless currency control asks (instantly written into TPP for her) the only problems she has voiced with pending trade pacts like TPP, etc., but not ISDN?

Who are Hillary Clinton's biggest donors, and why does Clinton's progressive rhetoric benefit them, unsustainably, at the expense of most voters, the economy, and our future?

We all know "why," because she is desperate for votes now. What does Hillary really stand for: winning at all cost.
Bernie being Bernie with his dynamic platform is making her sweat.
